snippet: The health department is monitoring almost 300 people, including those involved in Dr. Craig Spencer’s care and recent arrivals to New York City from African countries hit hardest by the virus.
abstract: Hundreds of New York City Health Department workers are part of 24-hour-a-day operation keeping track of 289 people who have either recently come to city from countries hardest-hit by Ebola virus or were involved in care of city's first Ebola patient; travelers are not under quarantine because they said they did not have contact with Ebola patients; none of people being monitored has yet reported symptoms worrisome enough to prompt testing for virus.
lead_paragraph: The health department is monitoring almost 300 people, including those involved in Dr. Craig Spencer’s care and recent arrivals to New York City from African countries hit hardest by the virus.

headline.main: With Persistence and Phone Calls, Defending Against Ebola in New York
headline.print_headline: With Persistence and Phone Calls, Defending Against Ebola

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
